clinical_study.brief_title: Reappraisal of Atrial Fibrillation: Interaction Between HyperCoagulability, Electrical Remodeling, and Vascular Destabilisation in the Progression of Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: Reappraisal of Atrial Fibrillation: Interaction Between HyperCoagulability, Electrical Remodeling, and Vascular Destabilisation in the Progression of Atrial Fibrillation - An Observational Exploratory Study on Pathophysiological Mechanisms of AF Progression and on the Role of LinQ/CareLink Guided Patient Tailored Therapy in Patients With Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to study clinical factors and (blood) biomarkers related to progression of Atrial Fibrillation (AF) in patients diagnosed with self-terminating AF with special reference to hypercoagulability. All patients will be continuously monitored for their atrial rhythm to assess AF progression, either through an implantable loop recorder (Reveal LinQ) or via the atrial lead of a cardiac implantable electronic device (CIED), both in combination with the CareLink home monitoring system. Remote monitoring and interrogation will be installed and used on a daily basis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Major Adverse Cardiac and Cerebrovascular Events
Change in therapy due to continuous rhythm monitoring with the LinQ/Carelink system

study_pop.textblock: Patients with paroxysmal (self-terminating) AF in the cardiology outpatient department, first (heart) aid and pacemaker clinic.
